transcripts.text: Can I ask you a question, sir?  Absolutely.  So what's your name?
Ted Masters.
Thanks for talking to me, Ted.  So I'd rather be an American than a Democrat.  I assume you're saying Democrats aren't Americans.
No, the Democrats just want socialism.  That's not American.  They want free everything.  That's not American.
Are you on Social Security?  Are you on Social Security?
I am, but I work a full-time business.
I know, but you're aware Social Security is a socialist program.
Well, that's beside the point.
You just said you don't want socialism.
That's fine.  That's fine.  I don't want socialism across the board.
Are you going to go give up your Social Security tomorrow?
I would give up my Social Security if I had to.
I'm just making the point.  You're saying you don't want socialism, but you're enjoying it.  No, no.  You are on a socialist program.
Wait a second.  No, I'm not, because I paid into Social Security for 50 years before I started drawing off of it.  Right.
But it's redistribute redistribution.  Young people right now, young people.
I earned it.
OK, so.  But you agree it's a socialist program that the Veterans Administration is a socialist program.  The veterans health care.
You know what?  The veterans deserve everything they get.  They're the ones that stood up and fought for you and I so we can stand here and talk freely.
We're in agreement.  I'm just saying we already have socialist programs that you're.
That's fine.  A few of them are fine, but not across the board.
Okay, so which ones are you afraid of?
I've been in the health insurance business for 30 years.  We cannot afford socialized medicine.
Can we afford endless war?
We cannot afford single-payer health insurance.
Can we afford endless war?  We spent $6 trillion in Iraq and Afghanistan.  Were you out here talking about that?
President Trump isn't looking for that either.  He's trying to pull everything back.
What are you talking about?  The debt has exploded under Trump.  The debt is up double.
You know what?  That might be true.  But he's also created far more business than anybody in history.  And as the business grows, the business taxes will pay that off.  You've got to understand...
No, no, no.  Let's just talk the facts, though.
It takes a free economy to pay off debt.
Right, but if what he's doing is mostly deregulation and tax cuts for wealthier people, which that's what the tax cuts were for, that's...
It's the wealthy people who create business and jobs for you.

So why is it that such a large portion of America work minimum wage jobs to a little over minimum wage?  Wait, and you have an exploding income inequality in this country.  If the wealthy people are creating the jobs, why are so many people living paycheck to paycheck?
That's a has-been.
Has-beens are living paycheck to paycheck?
Yes, because it's coming around the other way.  It's taking time.  But we have more people working today than we have had in history.  We've got fewer people on welfare and fewer people creating...
We don't have fewer people on welfare than in history.
We don't.  Where have you been looking at your statistics?
The Bureau of Labor and Statistics.
Yeah, well, I think you're screwed up.
Well, I could read, so.  No, but what I'm asking you, because the unemployment is low, a lot of people have left the workforce, so that brings down the unemployment rate.  The real unemployment...
A lot of people are coming back.  A lot of people are coming back.
And where are you getting that from?
That's coming from statistics.

Because if you look at the states he won, I'm talking Michigan, Wisconsin, Pennsylvania, Ohio, he said he's going to bring these plants back.  And they're coming back.  No, they're not.  I've been there in the last two years.  The plants are still closed.  This Foxconn plant he talked about in Wisconsin, that they got huge, huge tax subsidies from Wisconsin for Foxconn, they're not actually creating those jobs anymore.  They're switching what Foxconn is going to be away from making specialized glass for TVs to research and development.  So he's not opening these.  General Motors just laid off 15,000 people.  He told the people in Lordstown, Ohio, don't move.  So what are you talking about?  that he's brought back all these jobs?
Sometimes businesses have to retool in order to make things work.
Retool, meaning send the jobs offshore and do stock buybacks?
I'm not talking about sending jobs offshore.

But his tax cut, the businesses have bought back stock buybacks.  That's what they did with the tax cut.  These are facts.  This has been reported.  With the money from the tax cuts, they bought back their stock to drive up the shares for investors.

That's fine.  Then they can continue on to build other businesses and create jobs.  It takes time.  You can't create jobs literally overnight.  It takes time for a corporation to rehire people and get things going.

What are the 15,000 people supposed to do that were laid off by General Motors?  How much time should they wait?  Or the workers at Burger King, McDonald's that are working... 40 hours a week there, another job, and barely could put a roof over their head.  Are they has-beens?
At least they have a job.  At least they have a job.  Things are better than it used to be.  That's the bottom line.
What did it used to be like?
It's gotten better over the last three years.
And it's better.  how?
There's more jobs to go around to people.  I've got a lot of people in the ghetto community that I happen to live next to.
The ghetto community?
In Boynton Beach.
that you the ghetto community what?  what is that?  a point beach a poor black community.
it's a big area and there's more people there.
early races.
a racist comment but go ahead you know what i don't want to talk to you anymore.
okay because you said something racist you've been.
you've been swallowing the soup so goodbye.
you made a racist comment that i called you on it.  okay the ghetto community is peace and love.  that's what you meant.
It's peace and love, and it's been a lot of unopportunity.  And the people with unopportunity have been coming back to work.
